content:
• Friday, January 25, 2013
  • RIG

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) +2.5% AH after Carl Icahn calls for a $4/share dividend and says he will...

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) +2.5% AH after Carl Icahn calls for a $4/share dividend and says he will propose the dividend at the next meeting if RIG's board doesn’t act. Icahn now owns a 5.6% in the offshore rig contractor, but says in the SEC filing that nothing should be construed as an intention to launch a takeover.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • KRO

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: KRO +5%. AUMN +5%. LRN +3%. PHH +3%. RIG +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: KRO +5%. AUMN +5%. LRN +3%. PHH +3%. RIG +2%.
    After-hours top losers: TEX -7%. MCP -6%. OSK -6%. LVNTA -5%. SIVB -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN +3.8%) surged to new highs ahead of Tuesday's Q4 report: shares are now up 27% from...

    Amazon (AMZN +3.8%) surged to new highs ahead of Tuesday's Q4 report: shares are now up 27% from where they stood going into the Q3 report. Solid numbers from eBay, Google, and Overstock have heightened expectations, and so have reports of a decent holiday season. Investors could feel let down if Amazon further delays profit growth for the sake of long-term investments: the Street is now expecting a 65% increase in operating cash flow in 2013 to $10.68/share (per Bloomberg).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • COHR

    Coherent (COHR +10.6%) continued its recent rally in the wake of its FQ1 report. Though results...

    Coherent (COHR +10.6%) continued its recent rally in the wake of its FQ1 report. Though results were mixed, the industrial/electronics laser vendor guided in prepared remarks (.pdf) for FQ2 revenue of $193M-$203M, above a $192.7M consensus. Also, FQ1 gross margin rose 100 bps Q/Q to 42.6%, and book-to-bill was 0.96, a healthy figure in light of macro (Europe) and industry-specific (science, electronics/chips) challenges. Peers rose in sympathy: IPGP +2.2%. NEWP +1.5%. RSTI +2.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CRUS

    Apple may have added to its losses today, but Cirrus Logic (CRUS +10%), believed to get ~3/4 of...

    Apple may have added to its losses today, but Cirrus Logic (CRUS +10%), believed to get ~3/4 of its revenue from Apple, nearly made up for yesterday's drubbing after the Street concluded the below-consensus guidance accompanying Cirrus' FQ3 beat was more than priced in. Also: Cirrus' FQ4 gross margin is expected to be flat Q/Q in spite of a major revenue drop, and the chipmaker noted on its earnings call its efforts to win additional mobile OEM customers and grow LED lighting controller chip sales are paying off. (shareholder letter) (slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • MMM

    3M (MMM +0.9%) realigns it's Canadian business structure to better serve its markets and its...

    3M (MMM +0.9%) realigns it's Canadian business structure to better serve its markets and its customers. The move is part of a global realignment set in motion at the beginning of the year.  The new structure will be made up of five business groups: Consumer, Electronics & Energy, Health Care, Industrial, and Safety & Graphics. Previously, the business had six major segments. Read more detail on MMM's restructing in its earnings call transcript available here: Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -1.7%) slips after saying that global sales of machinery, such as excavators...

    Caterpillar (CAT -1.7%) slips after saying that global sales of machinery, such as excavators and bulldozers, were down 1% from a year earlier for the three months ended December 31, while engine sales declined 2%, hurt by weaker demand in Asia and North America. The decline was the first since April, 2010, and stands in stark contrast to yesterdays survey results showing that loans and leases for business equipment in the U.S. rose in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 5 Comments
  • SFL

    Ship Finance International (SFL -7.3%) slides after last night's news that it increased the size...

    Ship Finance International (SFL -7.3%) slides after last night's news that it increased the size of its public offering of convertible senior notes due 2018 announced Jan. 24, by $100M to a total of $350M. Also, SFL says Deutsche Bank priced previously announced fixed-price offering of ~4.2M common shares at $16.50/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • RSH

    Shares of RadioShack (RSH +10%) shoot higher with comments out from Deutsche Bank that the...

    Shares of RadioShack (RSH +10%) shoot higher with comments out from Deutsche Bank that the retailer is at a "pretty significant" crossroads. After the company's partnership with Target fizzled, it appears to be launching another Hail Mary with a plan to grow its brand in emerging Asian markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR +3.9%) is higher as the Street decides a Q4 beat and in-line Q1 EPS guidance is...

    Juniper (JNPR +3.9%) is higher as the Street decides a Q4 beat and in-line Q1 EPS guidance is good enough, even if revenue guidance is light. Also, product revenue was flat Y/Y after falling 3% in Q3, and op. margin rose 130 bps Q/Q to 18.2% thanks to job cuts. Enterprise sales fell 10% Y/Y (share loss, esp. in security), but service provider sales (65% of total) rose 9%, fueled by demand for MX Series edge routers and PTX Series Ethernet switches. Americas sales +17%, offsetting EMEA weakness. RVBD +2.9%. FFIV +1.7%. FTNT +4%. FIRE +2.5%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • IAG

    IAMGOLD (IAG -3.6%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a $10 price target, down from $16.50,...

    IAMGOLD (IAG -3.6%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a $10 price target, down from $16.50, at BofA/Merrill after the miner forecast significantly higher costs in 2013. IAG's operating guidance showed cash costs rising 20%-30% Y/Y to $850-$925/oz. due to lower ore grades mined, inflationary factors and harder ores.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • IMGN

    Shares of Immunogen (IMGN -2.4%) slip today after its FQ2 loss comes in wider than the analyst...

    Shares of Immunogen (IMGN -2.4%) slip today after its FQ2 loss comes in wider than the analyst consensus. Revenue fell 65% Y/Y on an absence of milestone payments, while higher R&D costs hurt its bottom line. The company attributes the higher expenses to greater investment in advancing its wholly owned product candidates, increased clinical trial costs, and increased personnel expenses. The biotech firm maintained its FY13 guidance, calling for a net loss of $70M to $74M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • STEC

    Solid-state drive makers STEC (STEC +6.3%) and OCZ (OCZ +6.7%) are posting big gains in the...

    Solid-state drive makers STEC (STEC +6.3%) and OCZ (OCZ +6.7%) are posting big gains in the absence of major news. 21.1% of STEC's float, and 31.4% of OCZ's, was shorted, as of Dec. 31. The companies are facing growing competition from the likes of SanDisk, Micron, and Samsung, who can source NAND flash memory at cost. On the flip side, IHS is forecasting SSD shipments will more than double this year to 83M, fueled by growing ultrabook sales and enterprise adoption.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • ARWR

    Arrowhead Research (ARWR -7%) slides today after pricing its 1.65 million unit public offering...

    Arrowhead Research (ARWR -7%) slides today after pricing its 1.65 million unit public offering at $2.12 per unit. Each unit consists of one share of common stock and one warrant to purchase 0.50 of a share of common. The company intends to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, including R&D and clinical trial expenditures,

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • AWK

    American Water Works (AWK -4%) slips today after releasing weak guidance for FY12 and FY13. The...

    American Water Works (AWK -4%) slips today after releasing weak guidance for FY12 and FY13. The company nowe expects FY12 EPS from continuing operations to be at the low end of the previously issued guidance range of $2.12 - $2.22. Analysts are expecting an EPS of $2.19. For FY13, it anticipates its EPS to be in the range of $2.15 - $2.25, towards the low end of analyst estimates of $2.22.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • EFII

    Midday top 10 gainers: EFII +15%. OSK +15%. SHIP +15%. SYNA +15%. LSCC +14%. NFLX +14%. QLGC...

    Midday top 10 gainers: EFII +15%. OSK +15%. SHIP +15%. SYNA +15%. LSCC +14%. NFLX +14%. QLGC +13%. BDR +13%. CIMT +13%. CRUS +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: NFBK -27%. ZN -26%. SCSS -18%. SCSC -15%. OTC:BGMD -15%. CTRP -13%. HTCH -11%. EGHT -10%. ARWR -8%. MSL -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • HAL

    Halliburton (HAL +5%) CEO Dave Lesar believes Q4 marked the bottom for North American margins,...

    Halliburton (HAL +5%) CEO Dave Lesar believes Q4 marked the bottom for North American margins, although the U.S. pressure-pumping market will remain oversupplied without a rebound more significant than he expects. In an effort to keep prices from dropping further, HAL has idled 10 fleets and retired two older fleets from service rather than going after lower-priced transactional work.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • LSCC

    In spite of missing Q4 estimates and guiding for a 2%-4% Q/Q revenue drop for Q1 (consensus is...

    In spite of missing Q4 estimates and guiding for a 2%-4% Q/Q revenue drop for Q1 (consensus is for a 2% increase), Lattice Semi (LSCC +13.8%) is soaring today. Below-consensus guidance from larger rivals Altera and Xilinx had served to depress expectations. Also, Lattice's Q4 gross margin of 54.2% was at the high end of its guidance range, and in spite of the expected revenue drop, the chipmaker forecasts Q1 gross margin will be in a range of 52%-56%. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk (ADSK +4.3%) jumps after Goldman upgrades shares all the way to Conviction Buy from...

    Autodesk (ADSK +4.3%) jumps after Goldman upgrades shares all the way to Conviction Buy from Sell. The firm is encouraged by the CAD software giant's improved execution, as well as accelerating growth in the non-residential construction space. Shares are a little above where they traded when Goldman downgraded them to Sell in Dec. '11.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • CTRP

    Ctrip.com (CTRP -14.1%) is off sharply after Oppenheimer states a Ctrip exec disclosed the...

    Ctrip.com (CTRP -14.1%) is off sharply after Oppenheimer states a Ctrip exec disclosed the company's coupon program will extend to plane tickets. The firm sees this as evidence Chinese online travel firms remain mired in a price war. Ctrip's rally over the last 6 months had in large part been fueled by optimism industry price competition was cooling off.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • AG

    First Majestic Silver (AG -3.8%) says its Del Toro Silver Mine in Mexico has achieved initial...

    First Majestic Silver (AG -3.8%) says its Del Toro Silver Mine in Mexico has achieved initial silver production. Development of the three mines which comprise Del Toro has produced 97.7K metric tons of stockpiled ore. Phase 2 start-up is expected by July 1, while the final phase of production is on schedule for Q3 of 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • KLAC

    Chip equipment stocks are rallying thanks to strong results and better-than-feared guidance from...

    Chip equipment stocks are rallying thanks to strong results and better-than-feared guidance from KLA-Tencor (KLAC +8.8%), and Samsung's forecast for 2013 capex to be similar to 2012 levels. AMAT +2.4%. LRCX +5.6%. ASML +3.2%. CYMI +2.8%. RTEC +1.7%. There had been a lot of speculation Samsung would aggressively slash its capex budget this year. Samsung foundry rival TSMC (TSM -1%) is lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (RMBS +9.8%) has shot higher in the wake of its Q4 report. Though results missed...

    Rambus (RMBS +9.8%) has shot higher in the wake of its Q4 report. Though results missed estimates, the memory IP firm guided on its earnings call for revenue to rise to $58M-$63M in Q1. Customer licensing income is expected to total $60M-$65M vs. $61.6M in Q4. Management continues to talk up the potential of Rambus' LED tech.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • RMD

    ResMed (RMD +4.8%) moves up this morning after its FQ2 easily topped estimates late yesterday....

    ResMed (RMD +4.8%) moves up this morning after its FQ2 easily topped estimates late yesterday. Net earnings rose 24% Y/Y as the respiratory-device maker's revenue jumped, particularly in its Americas segment where it posted a 16% jump in sales, while revenue outside the Americas increased 10%. The better sales masked an increase in overall expenses for the quarter, with SG&A costs moving up 7%, largely due to a ramp-of its sales force, and R&D expenses rising by 11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • INFA

    Informatica's (INFA +10.4%) big Q4 beat (I, II) is stoking a rally in enterprise software...

    Informatica's (INFA +10.4%) big Q4 beat (I, II) is stoking a rally in enterprise software stocks. Microsoft's decent Server & Tools performance might also be helping . Business intelligence/analytics firms are among the standouts - SPLK +2.8%. QLIK +7.2%. TIBX +3.8%. TDC +3.9%. MSTR +3.5% - but there are also others. SAP +2.6%. RHT +3.3%. N +2.4%. CTXS +1.7%. On its earnings call, Informatica noted Facebook is a buyer of its new PowerCenter Big Data Edition software, which can handle data integration projects on Hadoop clusters and many other platforms.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) roars to a 12% gain as the dreamy week for investors roars on. That makes...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) roars to a 12% gain as the dreamy week for investors roars on. That makes for a 79% YTD return for a company that made just $8M in profits during its last quarter while Apple raked in a cool $13B to fall 12%. Money manager Ivanhoff capital sums up the action: "Expectations matter."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 12 Comments
  • HAL

    Halliburton (HAL +4.6%) hits a 52-week high following upside Q4 results, leading the oil...

    Halliburton (HAL +4.6%) hits a 52-week high following upside Q4 results, leading the oil services (OIH +1.5%) and energy (XLE +0.8%) sectors; peers SLB and BHI also move up. Barclays sees up-and-coming offshore drillers Atwood Oceanics (NYSE:ATW), Ocean Rig (NASDAQ:ORIG) and Pacific Drilling (NYSE:PACD) coming along for the ride as ways to gain exposure to the global proliferation of offshore drilling.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • QLGC

    QLogic (QLGC +18.6%) surges after reporting FQ3 revenue of $119.4M (-16% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.20,...

    QLogic (QLGC +18.6%) surges after reporting FQ3 revenue of $119.4M (-16% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.20, beating a consensus of $117.5M and $0.18. Storage adapter card and controller chip sales fell sharply Y/Y, while switch sales ticked higher. On its earnings call, QLogic guided for FQ4 revenue of $112M-$118M and EPS of $0.13-$0.17 vs. a consensus of $111.5M and $0.15. SA's Ashra Eassa offered a detailed bull case for QLogic a month ago. Rivals Emulex (ELX +1.5%) and Mellanox (MLNX +2.5%) are up a bit.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • HAS

    It's no surprise that toy stocks are lower after Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) issues a dour estimate on...

    It's no surprise that toy stocks are lower after Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) issues a dour estimate on its holiday sales. Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT), Jakks Pacific (NASDAQ:JAKK), and LeapFrog (NYSE:LF) all trade down, although the move by LeapFrog has some traders hopping about. With its tech focus and aggressive growth track, they argue, LeapFrog shouldn't get lumped into the malaise hitting traditional toy sellers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • EGHT

    8x8 (EGHT -12.3%) has plunged in spite of posting an FQ3 report that met Street estimates. A...

    8x8 (EGHT -12.3%) has plunged in spite of posting an FQ3 report that met Street estimates. A slow-but-steady rally over the last 6 months served to heighten expectations. Also, revenue churn rose to 2.6% from a record low of 1% in FQ2, something the VoIP/videoconferencing service firm blamed on terminated or reduced services for 6 customers. Average revenue/customer and subscribed services/customer each rose as 8x8 focuses on scoring larger deals. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • ZN

    Zion Oil & Gas (ZN -23.2%) shares plunge as the Israeli company says it is...

    Zion Oil & Gas (ZN -23.2%) shares plunge as the Israeli company says it is re-evaluating its exploration strategy and does not expect to drill a new exploratory well in H1 2013, citing significant changes in the country's permitting process, but hopes to drill near the end of 2013 or in 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • UAL

    United Continental (UAL -4.5%) slips lower after Buckingham Research and Bank of America both...

    United Continental (UAL -4.5%) slips lower after Buckingham Research and Bank of America both clip its wings. While Buckingham takes the carrier down to Neutral from Buy, BofA goes to an Underperform rating with a soft PT of $22.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACH

    Mongolia's government is asking China's largest coal producer, China Shenhua Energy, to help...

    Mongolia's government is asking China's largest coal producer, China Shenhua Energy, to help break a deadlock over terms of a souring coal supply deal with Aluminum Corp. of China (ACH -2.1%). Mongolia, which has huge and as yet lightly exploited mineral reserves, plans to cancel the $250M deal with Chalco it deems undervalued and potentially creates over-reliance on China.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • SGI

    SGI (SGI +6.1%) opens higher on an upgrade to Buy from Sterne Agee. The firm sees SGI as a big...

    SGI (SGI +6.1%) opens higher on an upgrade to Buy from Sterne Agee. The firm sees SGI as a big data play thanks to its traditional high-performance computing customers and arsenal of in-memory database and Hadoop solutions, and thinks margin growth can exceed expectations due to SGI's operating leverage. FQ2 results are due on Jan. 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • UAA

    Janney Capital weighs in on the departure of a key Under Armour (NYSE:UA) exec which rattled the...

    Janney Capital weighs in on the departure of a key Under Armour (NYSE:UA) exec which rattled the stock yesterday. "Mr. McCarthy's departure speaks to the difficulty the company has had in retaining senior level management." UA +2.3% premarket to take back some of the ground that was lost in the prior trading session.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • MTEM

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) +6.3% premarket after earning a $30M milestone payment from...

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) +6.3% premarket after earning a $30M milestone payment from drug partner Merck (NYSE:MRK), which started a late-stage study of THLD's pancreatic cancer drug. TH-302 is an investigational hypoxia-targeted drug designed to be activated under severe tumor hypoxic conditions, a hallmark of many cancers.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • HAL

    Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $45 target price, up from $37, at...

    Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $45 target price, up from $37, at Global Hunter, citing international growth that's far exceeding expectations. The firm says it is not a fan of pre-market rating changes after an event (Q4 earnings), but with HAL set to open up only a dollar or so this morning, it would be buying the name at these levels. Shares +4.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • INFA

    Premarket gainers: INFA +10%. TPX +10%. OTC:ECTE +9%. OSK +8%. STP +6%. THLD +7%. SNE +6%....

    Premarket gainers: INFA +10%. TPX +10%. OTC:ECTE +9%. OSK +8%. STP +6%. THLD +7%. SNE +6%.
    Losers: SCSS -15%. OTC:BGMD -15%. EGHT -10%. SFL -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment

  • Miller Tabak upgrades Panera Bread to a Buy rating with a juicy price target of $190. It's a bit...

    Miller Tabak upgrades Panera Bread to a Buy rating with a juicy price target of $190. It's a bit of a shot in the arm for the restaurant operator after all the focus on Chipotle's slowing growth caused a bit of angst for Panera investors over the last month. PNRA +1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • HAL

    More on Halliburton's (NYSE:HAL) Q4 results: Earnings fell 26% on weakness in its North...

    More on Halliburton's (NYSE:HAL) Q4 results: Earnings fell 26% on weakness in its North American completion and production business, where operating income shrank 45%, but EPS and revenues beat Wall Street estimates. But with prices for fracking equipment expected to continue falling amid a glut, earnings strength may be deceiving. Shares +4.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) gain 2.3% premarket as the company...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) gain 2.3% premarket as the company cruises right past Starbucks' quarterly report without taking on any water. If anything, the number of Verismo machine sold during the period showed the product isn't likely to be the category-killer some GMCR bears touted it would be and the K-cup market looks large enough for keep everyone percolating.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM | 5 Comments
  • MAT

    Shares of Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) are on watch after peer Hasbro set a negative tone on the toy...

    Shares of Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) are on watch after peer Hasbro set a negative tone on the toy sector by preannouncing Q4 earnings. Though Hasbro didn't offer a significant amount of color on holiday sales, consumer demand for physical toys appears to have weakened. MAT -0.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • HAS

    Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) preannounces Q4 earnings, saying it expects to report Q4 revenue of $1.28B...

    Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) preannounces Q4 earnings, saying it expects to report Q4 revenue of $1.28B and EPS for the full-year below the estimates of analysts. The rub: "Consumer demand through much of the holiday season was less than anticipated." HAS -4.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • TPX

    Things are all topsy-turvy in the mattress sector. Though both Tempur-Pedic (NYSE:TPX) and...

    Things are all topsy-turvy in the mattress sector. Though both Tempur-Pedic (NYSE:TPX) and Select Comfort (SCSS) reported weak sales trends (I, II), TPX is up 16.5% premarket while SCSS is off 15.6% as the former company beat estimates and the latter one lagged. The most important message flowing out from the sector is that both sales and margins fell during Q4. Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM) is up 1.1% premarket, while Sealy (ZZ) is inactive, but both look set for some volatility of their own.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARWR

    Two other biotechs undertaking secondary offerings today: Arrowhead Research (NASDAQ:ARWR) off...

    Two other biotechs undertaking secondary offerings today: Arrowhead Research (NASDAQ:ARWR) off 6.5% premarket - and Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) - off 10% premarket. (Arrowhead PR). (Anthera PR). (BG Medicine earlier).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • SNBR

    Shares of Select Comfort (SCSS) get dismantled in premarket action, falling 19.4%, after the...

    Shares of Select Comfort (SCSS) get dismantled in premarket action, falling 19.4%, after the company misses estimates with its Q4 report and guides its view for 2013 profits lower. The company says it was hit with a "significant sales slowdown" in the last two weeks of December.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM
  • BGMD

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD) -10% premarket after announcing a secondary to price this morning and its...

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD) -10% premarket after announcing a secondary to price this morning and its intention to purchase up to $12M of its stock from a big holder, Aspire Capital.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • SNE

    Sony's (NYSE:SNE) shares jump 8.5% in Tokyo following a report that the INCJ Japanese government...

    Sony's (NYSE:SNE) shares jump 8.5% in Tokyo following a report that the INCJ Japanese government fund will invest in a Nissan and NEC joint venture if it acquires Sony's lithium-ion battery operations, which the company is looking to sell as part of its restructure. INCJ is looking for other Japanese buyers also in order to prevent the battery technology from falling into foreign hands.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 AM

  • Calling 2012 the year of the "relaunching of the euro," ECB chief Mario Draghi makes upbeat...

    Calling 2012 the year of the "relaunching of the euro," ECB chief Mario Draghi makes upbeat comments at Davos. "The level of economic activity is in the process of stabilizing at very low levels and we foresee a recovery in the second part of the year," Draghi says." Along with increasing German business optimism, the comments help send the euro to an 11-month high of $1.3451. It's now +0.4% at $1.3432.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 AM | 1 Comment

  • More on U.K. Q4 GDP: GDP estimated to have been flat in 2012. Output of production industries...

    More on U.K. Q4 GDP: GDP estimated to have been flat in 2012. Output of production industries -1.8% Q/Q vs +0.7% in Q3; construction +0.3% vs -2.5%; services flat vs +1.2%. GDP also hurt by lower output from the North Sea. Economy is 3.3% smaller than at its peak in Q1 2008 and has only recovered about half the output lost during the financial crisis. Sterling takes a dive and is -0.1% vs the dollar, although the FTSE 100 (+0.1%) is holding up.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 AM

  • The weak yen helps Tokyo shares close sharply higher as Asian shares trade mixed, while those in...

    The weak yen helps Tokyo shares close sharply higher as Asian shares trade mixed, while those in Europe mostly rise. "Investors are becoming more optimistic about the earnings prospects for Japanese exporters with the yen weakening so much," says strategist Masaru Hamasaki. Continued falling CPI will only have strengthened the case of those who want lots more easing. Japan +2.9%, Hong Kong -0.1%, China -0.5%, India +0.8%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.5% London flat, Paris +0.3%, Frankfurt +0.5%, Milan +0.6%, Madrid +0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 AM
